data.description: Datadog is seeking an Internal Communications Program Manager to help employees get the most out of our internal communications ecosystem. In this role, you’ll work cross-functionally to define, promote, and uphold standards that ensure Datadogs can easily find the information they need, when they need it. You’ll collaborate with Enterprise IT, Operations, People, Legal, and other teams to keep our intranet and internal communication channels accurate, accessible, and up-to-date. You’ll develop new tools and optimize existing ones to support companywide communication objectives, and you’ll use data from our systems to measure effectiveness and identify opportunities to improve. This is an individual contributor role reporting to the Senior Manager of Internal Communications.At Datadog, we place value in our office culture, the relationships and collaboration it builds, and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.What you’ll doDefine and enforce governance frameworks and best practices for internal communication platforms (Confluence, Slack, Google Groups, Zoom Digital Signage, etc.).Lead efforts to maintain a clean, accurate, and up-to-date companywide intranet.Establish and promote companywide standards for internal documentation, including naming conventions, metadata, update cadences, and more.Convene and lead a cross-functional stakeholder council to champion communications best practices and address team-specific needs.Design and implement advanced workflows, automations, and integrations (APIs, webhooks, scripting, add-on architecture) that support communication and knowledge-management objectives.Analyze platform usage and trends, leveraging data to evaluate program effectiveness and inform strategy.Partner with teams such as Enterprise IT to ensure that content is sourced correctly and represented consistently across tools.Create documentation, training, and enablement materials for key technologies.Who you are:Experienced (8+ years) in managing an enterprise intranet or knowledge-management system, including advanced Confluence features.Have excellent communication and stakeholder-management skills: you can explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences, lead workshops or training, and partner cross-functionally.Energized by learning new tools and technologies in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.Skilled in Slack administration, including group management, auditing, and monitoring.A strong writer with solid editorial judgment and experience in an editorial or content-quality role.Comfortable using data and analytics to drive strategic content and operational decisions.Familiar with technical writing, documentation, information architecture, library sciences, system administration, or data management.Though not required, experience in system administration, software development, or scripting is preferred.Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about communication, technology, and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.Benefits and Growth: Best-in-breed onboardingGenerous global benefitsIntra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networkingNew hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathingAn inclusive company culture, able to join our Community Guilds and Inclusion TalksBenefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.Datadog offers a competitive salary and equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.The reasonably estimated yearly salary for this role at Datadog is:$105,000—$135,000 USDAbout Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.Equal Opportunity at Datadog:Datadog is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and other characteristics protected by law. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
